Posts.Content: Glad it was benign. Good luck with the surgery. Better to get it removed.
Posts.Title: Had my Stereotactic Biopsy on Friday.

Posts.Content: Hello, I remember you. I am praying you received benign results.
Posts.Title: Had my Stereotactic Biopsy on Friday.

Posts.Content: Hello I am 41 and going through the same thing. A cyst appeared 2 years ago, small movable. My ob/gyn aspirated it 3 times since then, sent out to lab, all ok but it still comes back! I made them aware of it for my mammogram last year, as a precaution, I have to go every 3 months for ultrasound of it. Now 6 months since there is no change. I too worry, I have my checkup in 1 month see what the doctor wants to do. I am told it is harmless cyst, very frustrating it keeps coming back. I would keep on top of it with the doctor & if they say keep getting it checked do so, it is a nuisance but better safe than sorry. I understand your worry with having a family history.
Posts.Title: Question Regarding Cysts

Posts.Content: I am glad you finally got in touch with your doctor.
Posts.Title: First Mammogram Results (need some advice) 1 2

Posts.Content: Maybe there is an area in question that want to double check on. From my experience they told me they can see so much more on an ultrasound than the mammogram. I pray someday they make the ultrasound the only test, since it is painless. Do not panic, it is probably nothing but just one area they are questioning. But go for the ultrasound because that will answer any questions they may have. By all means call your doctor too, maybe he or she will have more info to tell you. Keep my fingers crossed all is fine.
Posts.Title: First Mammogram Results (need some advice) 1 2

Posts.Content: Hi: You seem pretty young to have breast cancer but since you have a family history. I would go to an ob/gyn for an exam and see what they say. They may send you for a mammogram and ultrasound. That does not sound normal so I feel you need to have it checked out asap. Fingers crossed it is nothing. Keep us posted ok....
Posts.Title: Need advice on breast cancer; 18 y/o

Posts.Content: I have this problem. A cyst in same spot, it was aspirated twice and both times fluid sent to lab and all ok. Although it has come back but much smaller in fact they can see it on ultrasound but not on a mammogram. I am told nothing to worry about. There is not change in it and I get my yearly mammogram and breast exam from ob/gyn plus I check to see if it is the same as well. The doctor and person who reads the mammograms does not seem concerned so I will not be concerned.
Posts.Title: recurrent cyst a problem?

Posts.Content: I am no medical professional. I would think a MRI would tell more than mammogram and ultrasound. Yes a cyst would show up on an ultrasound. I sure hope you get some answers from a MRI. I wish my dr. would send me for one, I just had my annual mammogram and had to go back for more pics in my left breast, they also did ultrasound and went over and over like you. They are puzzled, not sure what they see?? They claim they see something that was not there a yr ago, but I physically feel a tiny lump in the area in question. Instead of a MRI they are making me get a biopsy to see if it is benign or malignant. This scares the hell out of me. I have to wait till end of month to see a breast specialist. I hope she has some answers for me that the radiologist did not. Post when you get some answers next week. I pray it is nothing serious for you. Some people never report the outcome, I am curious how everyone made out. (((HUGS)))
Posts.Title: Full of questions after my first mammo

Posts.Content: Hi: If the mammogram was normal than nothing to worry about BUT they are not 100% accurate. I would seek the advice of a breast specialist. Ob/gyn drs. are not really trained at reading mammograms, they just follow what the radiologists suggest. Seek a 2nd opinion to put your mind at ease, you probably have something harmless, but you don't want to keep worrying about it either. Have they done an ultrasound that shows a lot too. Keep us posted...
Posts.Title: Do I need a second opinion?

Posts.Content: Hi, it is precautionary. I am 46 and have very small breasts and told I have dense breast tissue too, I have gone numerous times for ultrasound after mammogram. I worried but all was ok. Only thing they say that with dense breast tissue, it is hard to read mammograms and they can see better with the ultrasound, I wish the ultrasound was the only test to get done, since it is painless. Mammograms are very painful for me. Word to the wise, do not go if you have your period or about to get it that will make it worse. Schedule your appointment 1 week after, it gives them a more accurate reading for mammogram. Good luck, sure you will be fine. I am in the same boat about the dense breasts.
Posts.Title: Dense Breast Tissue?

Posts.Content: Paperlaces: How are you doing? I will keep you in my thoughts on friday. Speedy procedure and recovery. Praying for good results for you. Keep me posted. I had a needle core biopsy yesterday, they numb you, you do feel pressure, I guess it took 10 - 15 minutes. Not bad. I get white coat syndrome so after the procedure I felt queasy, normal for me, I get like that after a blood test as well. My area in question was a different location that I thought. Spot with tiny cyst, she said was not of concern, another area was. So that worried me more. You go home with mini ice packs to put on and off for 30 minutes and put bandaid on the spot too. I didn't do ice after a few hours, I felt it put too much pressure on the area and hurt. I had some pain rest of day and they make you sleep in a bra for a night. Not sure if they do all the same stuff in Australia, but they also put a clip (marker) in the spot where biopsy was done for future reference. I should have my results by friday afternoon. Praying for good news but I am still worried sick.
Posts.Title: Lump and dense breasts 1 2

Posts.Content: How are you Paperlaces? Hope all went well. I finally got an answer. Doctor called me this afternoon and the findings are BENIGN. I have to follow up in early December for another mammogram and ultrasound of that area to confirm stability. Now I can breath a sign of relief and enjoy my weekend.
Posts.Title: Lump and dense breasts 1 2

Posts.Content: UPDATE: I am so CONFUSED..My doctor called to tell me to get a mammogram & ultrasound sooner rather than later (waiting till December). I said like how soon?? She said this month! I asked why?? She is being overly cautious. Still saying she was concerned how my mammogram looked, but the biopsy result is BENIGN! I am still sore from biopsy and bruised and also developed a water blister where darn band aid was. She wants me to come in on Friday to have it drained. So on August 20th, I will go for another mammogram and ultrasound of the area again. What could have possibly changed???? I AM WORRIED AGAIN!
Posts.Title: Lump and dense breasts 1 2

Posts.Content: Yes I am 48 and have dense breasts and they say my mammograms are hard to read. I do get ultrasounds as well. I do not know when they order MRI? I know they cost more. They recently found something abnormal on my left breast, I can feel it too. Mammo and Ultrasound left them clueless so now I too go for biopsy. next week Good thing you only have to wait 1 week, I go next week and my wait time is 4 weeks. Yes the waiting is HORRIBLE! Just want it over with with answers. I pray it is benign for you and me. HUGS to you. Please post next week.
Posts.Title: Lump and dense breasts 1 2

Posts.Content: Meg, glad to hear your 6 month went well! I asked for copy of report, I know it wasn't fiberadema. Some medical term. I will post when I get it. Paperlaces: Glad all went well and benign. Why do they want you to get another biopsy in Jan? Ultrasound and mammo will show changes? I pray you get good report then.
Posts.Title: Lump and dense breasts 1 2

Posts.Content: Hi. Good luck at the dr. on tuesday, sorry to hear you need surgery. Did I miss something, I thought everything was fine?? Now you are getting surgery? Keep us posted. {Hugs} My follow up on the 20th went fine, they almost said it was a waste of time. But did both tests because my doctor insisted. All is fine no changes and go back in 6 months to confirm stability with benign issue.
Posts.Title: Lump and dense breasts 1 2

Posts.Content: Thanks for sharing your story and good luck on 8/7 with your surgery. Sending you good results. Keep us posted.
Posts.Title: My Story and choices

Posts.Content: Hi Paperlaces: You are blessed to have free tests. I have medical insurance but these tests are expensive, I think a mammogram alone is around $500 here in US. My appointment with a breast specialist and possible biopsy is Tues. July 30. I am anxious to say the least. I have to bring prior mammogram test results and ultrasounds too. I was referred to her by my doctor then she will decide if a biopsy is needed. I want the biopsy done that day, but who knows? I pray they do because this long wait is awful. Not counting the waiting of the biopsy result as well. Trying to keep busy to take my mind off of things.
Posts.Title: Lump and dense breasts 1 2

Posts.Content: Thanks. Good Luck to you today. I wish it was friday here. I have another day of waiting. Only 930am Thursday here. Curious how many hours ahead of us are you? I am thinking like 16???? I am only sore if I accidentally brush up against it. What is irking me I have a tiny water blister where end of bandaid was. Not sure how to get rid of that?
Posts.Title: Lump and dense breasts 1 2

Posts.Content: Hi Paperlaces! Thanks for the hugs. Yes I think it was an allergic reaction. Hope your dr. visit goes well. You are still having pain in the area too. Mine is a soreness, if I press up against it. I pray I just have an overly cautious doctor, but not one, that wants to push surgery either. I will keep you posted, it helps talking to someone going thru this. To Meg: I was told it is a BENIGN condition called sclerosing adenosis. Condition that causes extra tissue to develop, it can make a mammogram look like exaggerated or distorted tissue, making it difficult to distinguish from breast cancer. I have read it can be a risk factor as well.
Posts.Title: Lump and dense breasts 1 2

Posts.Content: Hi Paperlaces: I understand, the constant worry is not good. Good luck to you and your sister with your surgery. Let me know how you are doing ok.
Posts.Title: Lump and dense breasts 1 2

Posts.Content: How did everything go? I hope all okay. I had something similar in left a few years back. worded that way architectural distortion. Mine turned out to me a small mass, lump it was precancerous. I had a lumpectomy. Got it all and no further treatment needed. Do not in no way want to worry or scare you, but that was my outcome. So it is better to get more photos and maybe ultrasound and or biopsy too. I pray all okay for you.
Posts.Title: Update from my last thread. Architectural Distortion.

Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by Penzfan Thank you for asking! I actually just had a breast ultrasound this morning, the doctor said it is a radial scar that is typically benign, but still needs a biopsy, which we scheduled for early september. I guess I can breathe a sigh of relief now. I am very glad that yours was not cancerous and that you had it taken out. I'm sure they will want to take this radial scar out as well. Glad to hear it is benign. Never heard of a radial scar. Good luck with your biopsy. Pray for a good outcome for you. Take care.
Posts.Title: Update from my last thread. Architectural Distortion.

Posts.Content: Thanks for posting this twohands. I am going through the same surgery at end of month. I am more anxious about the wire than the surgery itself. Good luck with your surgery Hopefulone1953.
Posts.Title: Wire Localization ?

Posts.Content: I am sorry to hear biopsy was positive What is the next step for you? I am still waiting for my results, now a week, I don't see doctor till next week. I assume no news is good news?? I am praying for good results.
Posts.Title: Wire Localization ?

Posts.Content: Happy to hear you are doing well and thank you for that positive post. Most people do not post updates and you don't know how they are doing. I agree if you give up or negative about it all, its not good. So glad you kept a positive attitude through it all. I wish you continued good health!
Posts.Title: Triple Negative Breast Cancer Survivor

Posts.Content: Some women do experience breast pain and when your hormones are all over. I have from time to time. From what I hear, usually there are no symptoms like pain in breast cancer. No symptoms at all. So I would try and not worry about, glad you are getting it all checked again in 6 months.
Posts.Title: Pain in left breast

Posts.Content: Thanks. I had it done on Wednesday, it was a stereotactic, so you lay flat on table that way with opening and mammo pics too, wasn't too bad, and by having my head down I did not see anything. Although I would have liked to see, seems weird for doctor to go under table to do this. LOL
Posts.Title: Wire Localization ?

Posts.Content: Thanks. Will post after my visit. Good luck to you.
Posts.Title: Wire Localization ?

Posts.Content: I am going through the same thing. I am 42, had my annual mammogram back in May and I have calcifications as well. I have a cyst that was aspirated a few times and it keeps coming back but sent to the lab and all ok. So this is the first time I ever heard "calcifications", I am told to go back in 6 months (Nov) for a follow-up mammogram. I am trying not to think or worry about it. Neither the mammogram place or my doctor seem concerned. They mentioned they are just checking for stability which I think they are doing for you as well. Keeping fingers crossed all ok for the both of us.
Posts.Title: Calcifications
